Comments_List: Nanoscale phenomena and related fundamental as well as empirical laws.
Learned a great deal about how to synthesize and characterize 0D, 1D, and 2D nanomaterials. Also learned about different applications for many types of nanomaterials.
I learned in depth of the important concepts about nanomaterials.
The professor should make it more interesting and appealing to students instead of just writing down equations and theory from notes.
Less materials but more rigorous derivations

A lot of what I learned was useful for my own research. Homework assignments were relevant exercises. TA was great.

Although I liked that there was only one test, another one may have been useful to reinforce what we learned in the second half of the semester.
Maybe try use board more often.
Yes. It is a very useful course to take if you are interested in nanotechnology.
great, I have learned a lot
Definitely! A great introduction to nanomaterials. Material was relevant for both graduate and undergraduate students.
Yes since the information covered are important for nanomaterials learning and research.
